definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The sad condition of these refugees would move a heart of stone to sympathy。
sentences.chinese: 这些难民的悲惨处境能使一个铁石心肠动容。

sentences.english: Noble, elegant living, Lily in the head, Xinxin moved.
sentences.chinese: 高贵气质，典雅生活，丽丽在目，鑫鑫动容。

sentences.english: Whoever sees the scene cannot help being moved.
sentences.chinese: 看到眼前的情景，人人为之动容。

sentences.english: Limin starts the youth freezing although she is only 20 years old.
sentences.chinese: 例句李敏今年才20岁，却已经开始动容了。

sentences.english: The sad condition of these refugees would move a heart of stone to sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 这些难民的悲惨处境能使一个铁石心肠动容。

sentences.english: Silently watch these let you audience intimate pictures of dogs and people.
sentences.chinese: 默默的看这些让你动容的狗狗与人的亲密照片吧。

sentences.english: Tian Jiye after listen to very touching.
There were so many great pieces that will endure.
sentences.chinese: 有很多伟大的作品令我动容。

sentences.english: How can you behave so shamelessly in public?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能在众人面前表现的毫不动容？

sentences.english: The filial piety youth story made us cry.
sentences.chinese: 孝心少年的故事让我们动容落泪。

definition: to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
